full_summary:
**Electrical Services for Summerland Research and Development Centre**

**Contract Solicitation Number:** 01R11-24-C014
**Date:** Open until 2023-05-09T16:00:00
**Contract Duration:** 3 years with an option to extend for 2 additional years

Agriculture and Agri-Food Canada's Summerland Research and Development Centre in Summerland, British Columbia is seeking a Contractor to provide electrical maintenance services on an as-needed basis. The contract will be awarded for a period of 3 years with the possibility of extending it for 2 additional one-year periods. The expected start date is June 1, 2023.

**Security Requirements:**
A valid Reliability Status is required for access to sensitive work sites.

**Site Visit:**
A mandatory site visit is scheduled for Tuesday, April 18, 2023, at 10:00 AM MDT. Bidders are requested to communicate with the Site Authority no later than Monday, April 17, 2023, at 3:00 PM to confirm attendance and provide the names of attendees.

**Evaluation Criteria:**
Bids will be evaluated based on technical and financial criteria. A bid must comply with the requirements of the bid solicitation and meet all mandatory technical evaluation criteria to be declared responsive. The responsive bid with the lowest evaluated price will be recommended for award of a contract.

**Bid Submission:**
Bids will be accepted by email only. Bidders shall submit their bids to Natalie O'Neill at natalie.oneill@agr.gc.ca and aafc.wscprocurement-csoapprovisionnement.aac@agr.gc.ca.

**Note:**
Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement. Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada. The Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at canadabuys.canada.ca/en/solicitation-opportunities provides access to all bid solicitations and related documents.

**Additional Information:**
The federal Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) is an online resource for identifying Indigenous business capacity. A profile in the IBD can increase visibility and provide additional business opportunities.

Please refer to the attached solicitation documents for further information. The Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) and the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP) are applicable to this procurement. Respondents are encouraged to familiarize themselves with these agreements.

Contact Information:
Natalie O'Neill, Contracting Specialist
